channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: In last-ditch effort, Democrats push to get Julie Su confirmed as Labor Secretary
item.description: Acting Secretary Julie Su has led the Labor Department for nearly two years, despite never getting a Senate confirmation vote. With time running out, her staunchest supporters haven't given up.
item.content:encoded:
Acting Secretary Julie Su has led the Labor Department for nearly two years, despite never getting a Senate confirmation vote. With time running out, her staunchest supporters haven't given up.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Lawmakers release spending bill to fund federal government until March 14
item.description: Congressional leaders released a stop-gap spending bill to fund the government until March 14.
item.content:encoded:
Congressional leaders released a stop-gap spending bill to fund the government until March 14.

(Image credit: ROBERTO SCHMIDT/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Carlos Watson gets nearly 10 years in prison in case about failed startup Ozy Media
item.description: Watson, 55, and the now-defunct company were found guilty last summer of charges including wire fraud conspiracy. He has denied the allegations and plans to appeal.
item.content:encoded:
Watson, 55, and the now-defunct company were found guilty last summer of charges including wire fraud conspiracy. He has denied the allegations and plans to appeal.

(Image credit: Stefan Jeremiah/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The president of the NCAA calls for a ban on 'prop bets' in college sports
item.description: As sports betting has spread across the U.S., college athletes have increasingly faced harassment from bettors. A federal ban on wagers that concern individual performances could help, the NCAA says.
item.content:encoded:
As sports betting has spread across the U.S., college athletes have increasingly faced harassment from bettors. A federal ban on wagers that concern individual performances could help, the NCAA says.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Harris nods to the coconut tree meme that started it all
item.description: Vice President Harris had some fleeting meme-mentum in the early days of her campaign. On Tuesday, she nodded to that in remarks to young voters.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris had some fleeting meme-mentum in the early days of her campaign. On Tuesday, she nodded to that in remarks to young voters.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: The Indian Movie Acclaimed Abroad But Snubbed at Home
item.description: The film "All We Imagine As Light" is an Indian film that has won rare international acclaim from Cannes and the Golden Globes. But at home in India the international buzz was ignored and it was passed over as India's entry for the Oscars. Our correspondent in Mumbai, where the film was shot, explores why it is not receiving the same acclaim in India.
item.content:encoded:
The film "All We Imagine As Light" is an Indian film that has won rare international acclaim from Cannes and the Golden Globes. But at home in India the international buzz was ignored and it was passed over as India's entry for the Oscars. Our correspondent in Mumbai, where the film was shot, explores why it is not receiving the same acclaim in India.

(Image credit: Christophe Simon)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Luigi Mangione is charged with murder as an act of terrorism in CEO's death
item.description: The man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare's CEO has been charged with murder as an act of terrorism. The indictment could help move along procedural steps toward extraditing the suspect.
item.content:encoded:
The man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare's CEO has been charged with murder as an act of terrorism. The indictment could help move along procedural steps toward extraditing the suspect.

(Image credit: Benjamin B. Braun)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Senators launch probe into sale-leaseback company, citing NPR's reporting
item.description: EasyKnock, the subject of the probe, announced its sudden closure earlier this month.
item.content:encoded: EasyKnock, the subject of the probe, announced its sudden closure earlier this month.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Thompson

item.title: Taking vitamin D is unlikely to prevent falls or fractures. Here's what it does
item.description: Vitamin D is good for the immune system, but in older people it doesn't prevent falls or fractures, according to health experts at the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force. Here's why you need it.
item.content:encoded:
Vitamin D is good for the immune system, but in older people it doesn't prevent falls or fractures, according to health experts at the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force. Here's why you need it.

(Image credit: Baac3nes/Moment RF)
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: The Wisconsin shooting suspect is female. That's rare, data says
item.description: Authorities say a 15-year-old girl carried out the shooting that killed two and wounded several at a Wisconsin school. Female shooters are relatively rare, statistically speaking.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities say a 15-year-old girl carried out the shooting that killed two and wounded several at a Wisconsin school. Female shooters are relatively rare, statistically speaking.

(Image credit: Andy Manis)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman
